name: BloodFest
overview: Since Bloodfest is freeware, Mellow Chips didn't have to worry about distributor censorship and anti-violence laws. This is one of the most gruesome games on the Amiga. You awake from hypersleep aboard a space station. The whole crew has been turned into horrifying, deformed monsters. The scenario and the graphics are probably inspired by Doom, the game mechanics are a simplified version of Dungeon Master. While the atmosphere is great, my complaint about Bloodfest is that it plays a bit too simple. Without a proper inventory and detailed character statistics, there isn't much to do in this game apart from finding an occasional keycard and - of course - killing the abominations roaming the corridors of the forsaken space station.
